titleInfo.title: 352HA1 Dallas Site 8HA1, Hamilton County, Tennessee. Mound. Features 14 and 20. Longitudinal cuts on post molds along south side of Feature 14 and around south entrance. Also indicates position of post molds at edge of depressed south entranceway

mods.abstract: [Feature 14] This structure formed base of mound. Over it was fill and rubble. Just above feature and lying on floor was charred roof and wall material and fragments from daubed walls. Has an entrance on south and east (See additional features: 20, 21, 22, and 23). [Feature 20] This bench forms the outer portion of Feature 14, serving as a bench or couch surrounding the central floor and fireplace. It is unbroken except for entrance corridor on south edge is rounded and molded. Built on a framework of canes in usual daub manner. When found was covered with grass.
mods.note: Observer illustrations available on file at institution. See also photographs 312HA1 [fhm00750], 313 HA1 [fhm00751] and 314HA1 [fhm00752], 315HA1 [fhm00753], 316HA1 [fhm00754], 317HA1 [fhm00755], 318HA1 [fhm00756], 319HA1 [fhm00757], 323HA1 [fhm00758], 325HA1 [fhm00759], 326HA1 [fhm00760], 342HA1 [fhm01119], 344HA1 [fhm01121], 347HA1 [fhm01123], 348HA1 [fhm01124], 349HA1 [fhm01125], 353HA1 [fhm01127], 696HA1(A) [fhm01946], 342HA1 [fhm02015], and 344HA1 [fhm02017].
